intro: Anisopetala annae, commonly known as the Annae's anisopetala, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its unique, asymmetrical petals. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as cloud forests. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom during the wet season. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
